name: Carnot Efficiency
explanation: Carnot efficiency is the maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine operating between two temperatures. It depends only on the hot (T_H) and cold (T_C) reservoir temperatures (in Kelvin). No real engine can exceed this efficiency. This sets the theoretical limit for all heat engines, including steam turbines, internal combustion engines, and power plants.

examples.problem: A heat engine operates between 500K and 300K. What is maximum efficiency?
A Carnot engine is 50% efficient with cold reservoir at 300K. What is T_H?
